Mayor Tim Davis

![Contact Website Resize (3)](https://www.templetx.gov/City%20Secretary/Contact%20Website%20Resize%20(3).png?t=202408191435300)
**About Mayor Tim Davis**

Tim Davis was elected to his first term as Mayor in May, 2018. Previously, he has served on the Temple City Council, District 1, since May 2013. He has been a resident of the area since 1995 and has lived in District 1 since 1997.
Tim is the owner of Novaura, a Temple-based employee benefits insurance agency.  As an active member of the Western Hills Church of Christ, Tim serves as the Director of the Mission Leadership Team. He is a 1989 graduate of Abilene Christian University with a degree in Accounting.
Tim is also a member of the Rotary Club of Temple, past president of the Sunrise Rotary Club of Temple, a member of the Temple Chamber of Commerce and the Temple Quarterback Club. Tim also chairs the Killeen Temple Metropolitan Planning Organization Policy Board and serves as a board member for the Temple Economic Development Corporation.
Tim and his wife, Jennifer have been married for over 38 years. They have 3 children, Hannah, Luke and Hope. They also have 3 grandchildren, Amelia, Alton and Everett.

**Contact Information:**
**Mailing Address:**
2 North Main Street, Ste 103 Temple, TX 76501
**Phone:**
(254) 298-5700
**Email:**
[tdavis@templetx.gov](mailto:tdavis@templetx.gov)

District 1 - Mayor Pro Tem Jessica Walker

![Councilmember Walker](https://www.templetx.gov/City%20Council/Councilmember%20Walker.jpg?t=202009161218010)
**About Mayor Pro Tem Walker**

Jessica was elected as Councilmember for District 1 in May of 2018. She is 3
generation Temple and graduated from Temple High School in 1984. After graduation from The University of Texas at Austin, she became a flight attendant for American Airlines and retired in 1999.  Jessica and her husband Bruce have been married for 30 years and together run Bruce’s family business Lengefeld Lumber Company.

She and Bruce have three children; Branan, 28, Harrison, 24 and Connally, 24 who all work for the family business. Bruce, also a Temple native, is involved in the Temple Area Builders Association. They attend First United Methodist Church in Temple.

**Contact Information:**
**Mailing Address:**
2 North Main Street, Ste 103 Temple, TX 76501
**Phone:**
(254) 298-5700
**Email:**
[jwalker@templetx.gov](mailto:jwalker@templetx.gov)

District 2 - Dr. Zoe Grant

![CityCouncil2023-4copy](https://www.templetx.gov/City%20Council/CityCouncil2023-4copy.jpg?t=202305301500210)

**About  Councilmember Grant**


Dr. Zoe Grant was elected as a Council member for District 2 in May of 2023. Originally from Denver, Colorado, she has been a Temple Resident since 2016. She serves as council liaison for the Planning and Zoning Commission, Zoning Board of Adjustment, Hill Country Transit District, Animal shelter Advisory Board and Keep Temple Beautiful Board. She has served on the City of Temple's Board of Adjustments, Neighborhood Revitalization Advisory Board, Comprehensive Plan Advisory Council, and Board of Appeals. She served on many boards that include Family Promise,  Temple Civic Theatre, Temple Founders Lions Club, Temple Railroad and Heritage Museum Foundation, A New Day Learning Academy, and Baylor Scott & White Medical Center Patient and Family Advisory Council. Dr. Grant is the NAACP Temple Branch President and remains a member of local organization boards that serve the residents of Bell County. Those boards include Cadence Bank Killeen-Temple Community Advisory Council. She is a Life Member of Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Incorporated, and a Life Member of the NAACP. She belongs to both the Temple Chamber of Commerce and the Innovation Black Chamber of Commerce (IBCC). She part of the District Neighborhood, one of the City of Temple's eighteen Neighborhood Coalition. She is a member of Ministry of Divine Purpose Church. She is the founder of Zoe's Wings Foundation, Inc.  She has two adult children, Ejevon (EJ), 42 (son, who lives in Colorado) and Davetta, 41 (Daughter), who is married to James Cross, and three granddaughters, Madison, 12, Jayda 6, and Brooklyn, 3, who live in Ft Worth, Texas

**Contact Information:**

**Mailing Address:**
**Phone:**

(254) 298-5700
**Email:**

[zgrant@templetx.gov](mailto:zgrant@templetx.gov)

District 3 - Karl Kuykendall

![KK Headshot](https://www.templetx.gov/KK%20Headshot.jpg?t=202509181049380)
**About Councilmember**

Karl Kuykendall is a seventh-generation Texan and cradle Catholic who has lived within the Diocese of Austin for over 50 years. Karl received Bachelor's and Master's degrees from Texas A&M University and is a graduate of the Southwestern Graduate School of Banking at S.M.U. Karl Kuykendall, a former Temple Independent School District school board member and commercial banker, served as president of Bank of America in Temple. He later oversaw commercial operations for the bank in Central, South, and West Texas. Mr. Kuykendall is an accomplished author writing books for the Catholic Diocese of Austin.  In 2023, Mr. Kuykendall published “Faith & Perseverance: The History of the Catholic Church in Central Texas,” exploring the history of the Catholic Church and creation of the Austin Diocese. Mr. Kuykendall also directed the production on “Treasures of the Diocese of Austin,” a coffee-table book commemorating the diocese’s 75th anniversary.  He has been active in civic and community activities for many years, and he has served the Catholic Church in various capacities. Karl was a member of the Finance Council of the Diocese of Austin for over 20 years and he is currently on the Executive Steering Committee for the 75th anniversary of the Diocese of Austin. Additionally, he serves on the Board of Our Kids at Heart, and he has been on committees for Ascension Texas Healthcare. Karl and his wife, Susan, are parents of one adult son, Will, and enjoy their standard poodles, Lili and Ana. Susan and Karl reside in Temple, Texas, where Karl is an active member of St. Mary Catholic Church, the Knights of Columbus, and the Knights of the Holy Sepulchre.
**Contact Information:**
**Mailing Address:**
2 North Main Street, Ste 103 Temple, TX 76501
**Phone:**
(254) 298-5700
**Email:**
[kkuykendall@templetx.gov](mailto:kkuykendall@templetx.gov)

District 4 - Mike Pilkington

![CityCouncil2023-4copy](https://www.templetx.gov/City%20Council/CityCouncil2023-2resized.jpg?t=202305301502490)


**About Councilmember Pilkington**
Mike was elected as District 4 Councilmember in May of 2023 after previously serving from 2016-2019.  Mike is a graduate of Belton High School and Tarleton State University.
He grew up in Temple and returned after college in 1994 to live in an area that is now part of District 4. With his return, he was employed with the family business Bell Contractors, Inc., a local utility construction company.  As of 2016, Mike has owned, operated and expanded the underground utility business his father established in 1977.
Mike's passion for serving the city spans over 25 years. He has served on many boards and commissions, including Planning & Zoning, Tax Increment Reinvestment Zone (TIRZ) No. 1, Development Standards Advisory Board, Parks & Recreation Advisory Board, Zoning Board of Adjustments, and several others. On a few of these boards, Mike has served as Chairman and/or Vice Chairman. He has also been involved for years in the Temple Area Builders Association and is currently Vice President of Government Relations for the Temple Chamber of Commerce.
He has been married to his wife, Laurel, for 30 years, and together they raised twin sons, Sammy and Lester (26). Mike and Laurel attend and are actively engaged in the Belton Church of Christ. When not working at his business or for the community, Mike enjoys hunting, fishing, motorcycle touring, and just about anything else outdoors.

**Contact Information:**
**Mailing Address:**
2 North Main Street, Ste 103 Temple, TX 76501
**Phone:**
(254) 298-5700
**Email:**
[mpilkington@templetx.gov](mailto:mpilkington@templetx.gov)
